text: <@U1DTE73MW|theath> has joined the channel
After an "Invoke" from the nodesdk to a chaincode, can I "listen" for completion of the Invoke?
i.e. without polling the chaincode to find out if the invoke finished?
<@U0KQ9QKH6|pmullaney> has joined the channel
<@U0S5KF44D> <@U0Z81GL6S> any chance you guys can fix the online doc for NPM?
for example: <https://www.npmjs.com/package/doc/classes/_hfc_.member.html>
thats a link from the front npm page, but it returns a 404
to date, ive only been able to see the doc by opening a file:// link from the git tree
but its super helpful info, so would be nice if people could get to it easily
To my best knowledge, the docs were removed from the repo for a reason. To see the docs, you need to build the docs locally first.
That is not something we want to be tracking inside the repo, as they are auto generated on build.
this issue has come up before, which is why I had taken them out.
Oh nvm….. you’re pointing to NMP…...
that should probably work yes as the docs ARE published to NPM
right, i mean when I go to NPM page, the doc is broken
yes, it should work… but i can’t fix it currently
i am working on something more urgent at the moment
could revisit soon
sure
is there an issue to track this, or shall I create one?
To be clear, I mean doc like this: <https://www.npmjs.com/package/hfc#going-deeper>
if I try to click on “Member”, for instance, I get a 404
Greg, yes pls create an issue to track.  Thx
<@U0S5KF44D>: ok, will do
on a positive note, I converted my tooling from hlc-v0.0.12 to hfc-v0.0.3 today and saw no issues
you probably already knew that, but figured you might appreciate an extra data point
good to hear
<@U0S5KF44D>: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/2339>
